title: 2021 Australian Open – Men's singles
text:
Two-time defending champion <a href="Novak%20Djokovic">Novak Djokovic</a> defeated <a href="Daniil%20Medvedev">Daniil Medvedev</a> in the final, 7–5, 6–2, 6–2 to win the men's singles tennis title at the 2021 Australian Open. It was his record-extending ninth <a href="Australian%20Open">Australian Open</a> title and his 18th <a href="Grand%20Slam%20%28tennis%29%23Tournaments">major</a> title overall. With his fourth round win against <a href="Milos%20Raonic">Milos Raonic</a>, Djokovic joined <a href="Roger%20Federer">Roger Federer</a> as only the second man with 300 or more <a href="Open%20Era%20tennis%20records%20%E2%80%93%20men%27s%20singles%23Career%20totals">match wins in major</a> singles competitions.
This tournament marked the first time since <a href="1999%20Australian%20Open%20%E2%80%93%20Men%27s%20singles">1999</a> that Roger Federer did not enter the Australian Open, ending a record streak of 21 consecutive appearances. in the 21st century that Federer did not play at the Australian Open, withdrawing prior to the tournament. 
<a href="Aslan%20Karatsev">Aslan Karatsev</a> became the first male qualifier to reach a major semifinal since <a href="Vladimir%20Voltchkov">Vladimir Voltchkov</a> in the <a href="2000%20Wimbledon%20Championships%20%E2%80%93%20Men%27s%20Singles">2000 Wimbledon Championships</a>, and the first since <a href="Bob%20Giltinan">Bob Giltinan</a> in <a href="1977%20Australian%20Open%20%28December%29%20%E2%80%93%20Men%27s%20Singles">December 1977</a> to do so at the Australian Open. He was also the lowest-ranked player to reach a major semifinal since <a href="Goran%20Ivani%C5%A1evi%C4%87">Goran Ivanišević</a> (ranked 125) at the <a href="2001%20Wimbledon%20Championships%20%E2%80%93%20Men%27s%20Singles">2001 Wimbledon Championships</a>, the lowest ranked to do so at the Australian Open since <a href="Patrick%20McEnroe">Patrick McEnroe</a> (also ranked 114) in <a href="1991%20Australian%20Open%20%E2%80%93%20Men%27s%20Singles">1991</a>, and the first man to reach a major semifinal in the <a href="Open%20Era">Open Era</a> on their main draw debut.
This was the first major in the Open Era to feature three Russian men in the quarterfinals, those being Karatsev, Medvedev and <a href="Andrey%20Rublev">Andrey Rublev</a>.

The following are the seeded players. Seedings are based on ATP rankings as of 1 February 2021. Rankings and points before are as of 8 February 2021.
